org.eclipse.keyple.core.service

Interface Reader

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DontWaitForCardRemovalDuringProcessing, ObservableReader, ObservableReaderNotifier, ProxyReader, SmartSelectionReader, WaitForCardInsertionAutonomous, WaitForCardInsertionBlocking, WaitForCardInsertionNonBlocking, WaitForCardRemovalAutonomous, WaitForCardRemovalBlocking, WaitForCardRemovalDuringProcessing, WaitForCardRemovalNonBlocking
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLocalReader, AbstractObservableLocalAutonomousReader, AbstractObservableLocalReader, AbstractReader

    public interface Reader
    Defines the high level API to access a card reader.
    • To retrieve the unique reader name
    • To check the card presence.
    • To activate and deactivate the card protocols.
    • To tell if the communication is contactless or not.
    The interface is used by applications processing the card.
    Since:
    0.9

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the reader
        Returns:
        A not empty string.
        Since:
        0.9

      • isCardPresent

        boolean isCardPresent()
        Checks if is the card present.
        Returns:
        true if a card is present in the reader
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderIOException - if the communication with the reader or the card has failed
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - is called when reader is no longer registered
        Since:
        0.9

      • activateProtocol

        void activateProtocol(java.lang.String readerProtocolName,
                      java.lang.String applicationProtocolName)
        Activates the provided card protocol and assigns it a name.
        • Activates the detection of cards using this protocol (if the plugin allows it).
        • Asks the plugin to take this protocol into account if a card using this protocol is identified during the selection phase.
        • Internally associates the two strings provided as arguments.
        • The #readerProtocolName argument is the name of the protocol among those supported by the reader.
        • The #applicationProtocolName is the name of the protocol to be the plugin when a card using this protocol is detected.
        Note: in the case where multiple protocols are activated, they will be checked in the selection process in the order in which they were activated. The most likely cases should therefore be activated first.
        Parameters:
        readerProtocolName - A not empty String.
        applicationProtocolName - A not empty String.
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderProtocolNotSupportedException - if the protocol is not supported.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - is called when reader is no longer registered
        Since:
        1.0

      • deactivateProtocol

        void deactivateProtocol(java.lang.String readerProtocolName)
        Deactivates the provided card protocol.
        • Inhibits the detection of cards using this protocol.
        • Ask the plugin to ignore this protocol if a card using this protocol is identified during the selection phase.
        Parameters:
        readerProtocolName - A not empty String.
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderProtocolNotSupportedException - if the protocol is not supported.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - is called when reader is no longer registered
        Since:
        1.0

      • isContactless

        boolean isContactless()
        Tells if the current card communication is contactless.
        Returns:
        True if the communication is contactless, false if not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - is called when reader is no longer registered
        Since:
        1.0
